data.title: Added fullscreen and distraction free modes
data.body:
Added fullscreen and distraction free modes.

`Shift+F11` to enter fullscreen mode.
`Ctrl+Shift+F11` to enter distraction free mode

Distraction free mode hide everything apart from the 2D, 3D  and Script panel.
Full Screen mode hides the side panels and the bottom panel (output, debug, animation bar).

data.title: Switched the space shooter demo from none fixed process to fixed process.
data.body:
The space shooter demo was stuttering alot, so I have minimized the
stuttering by switching from a none fixed process to a fixed process.

data.title: Theme editor preview broken.
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OSX 10.11.5, Godot built from [73918100b](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/73918100b)

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Theme editor preview broken.
![godot_theme_preview_bug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/122736/15655553/c718b286-26a6-11e6-8711-3d8f678f4b30.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create new project
2. Create new scene
3. Add Control node
4. Create new theme for control (in Control inspector)
5. Inspect the created theme

data.title: Properly detect .h as a C++ header file
data.body: Github shows Godot as a C project, which it isn't. This will fix it.

data.title: Fixed and improved search bar
data.body:
Important changes:
- Search no longer selects the results.
- Return focus to the text editor when hiding the bar.
- Fix connecting to invalid signal `_text_changed`. Fixing this made me notice another bug where the caret cursor was being moved to the search result after searching due to text editor writing.
- Update/redraw the text editor after searching.

After this PR, replace won't longer replace the current selected word (inherited behaviour from `FindReplaceDialog`) but the current search result. This is because just comparing the selection and the search text ignores the search flags like _Match Case_ and _Words Only_.

data.title: Endless re-importing with plugins written in GDScript
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Arch Linux x86_64 - Godot 2.1 alpha compiled with  dde995a5134d2421f987200542e50547484d956f

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

Editor auto re-import changed files once and once again cannot be stopped.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create a project and copy the demo plugin `demos/plugins/custom_import_plugin` folder into `addons` under the project.
2. Active the `Silly Materia Importer` plugin in project setting.
3. Copy the demo file `addons/custom_import_plugin/test.mtxt` outside of the project and import with the `Silly Materia Importer` plugin.
4. Edit and save the import source file `test.mtxt`.
5. Back to the editor it would start re-import an never stop.

**Link to minimal example project** 

https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B0AolAabr5edQl9KekdWeUdWOWM

data.title: Redefine var results in an error
data.body:
Error raised if redefine
- function argument
- for-loop argument
- local-scope var

Affects #3730

Well, there is still a dirty hack with `cf_for->body->variables.push_back(id->name);`. It is the only simple way Ive found for protect for-loop var from being redefined.

And I'm pretty sure I've missed something important =/

data.title: VisualServer.free() conflicts with Object.free()
data.body:
godot 2.0.3 _bugsquad edit -- it was 2.3.0_

when trying to call VisualServer.free(RID) engine just takes Object.free() function and throws exception that free function on base VisualServer takes 0 arguments

call and funcref doesn't help too

but editor suggests right function footprint tooltip after opening a brace

P.S. may be there is some workaround right now?

data.title: Color.r8 treated as float by binary And operator
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Official 2.0.3stable Win64
Windows 8.1

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
According to the documentation, Color.r8 .g8 and .b8 are int.
It should be thus possible to make binary operations with them, but the debugger says that :
`invalid operands 'float' and 'int' in operator '&'`

**Steps to reproduce:**
Run the code below.

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

```
var c = Color(250,150,100)
var x = c.r8 & 0xF0
```

data.title: windows/mingw build error on latest sync
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
windows (7) building via scons/mingw

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

build of current sources fails:
`In file included from platform\windows\os_windows.cpp:54:0:`
`platform\windows\joystick.h:36:96 fatal error: xinput.h: No such file or directory`
 `#include <xinput.h> // on unix the file is called "xinput.h", on windows I'm sure it won't mind`

(an identical failure occurs in joystick.cpp:30:0 since it includes joystick.h also)

Except that it _does_ mind and halts the build!

**Steps to reproduce:**
`scons platform=windows -j8`

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
this is just the latest sync of the current github sources

data.title: Multiple skeleton animations at once
data.body:
It would be very nice I think to be able to reprouce multiple weighted animations at once for one skeleton. This way you could blend more than two animations and the blending could be perfromed depending on other parameters than time.

For instance let say I've got animations A, B and C I should be able to play animation 0.3_A + 0.4_B + 0.3*C. This would be useful for instance when playing walking animations where you must blend between multiple walking stiles (slow, medium, fast) depending on the velocity you are moving.

It would also be nice to have animations to only affect some bones, so that different animations can affect different bones when combined ("Walking" and "Shooting" for instance)

data.title: Ragdoll Support: override centre of mass on 3D rigid bodies and set as toplevel during integration phase
data.body:
This PR includes two enhancements to the physics system, specifically how the physics system integrates with the game's tree hierarchy. The first is that it allows you to override the centre of mass on rigid bodies. Originally, a rigid body's center of mass would always be its origin, regardless of where collision objects were positioned. The integration should account for this and work as expected, even with joints. The reason for wanting such a feature is primarily to support ragdoll physics. It's complicated to explain why I feel this feature is nessecary, but consider how an articulated ragdoll should work. Ideally, you would want to place the rigid body at the origin point of the corresponding bone, while repositioning the collision object to better represent the length to the next bone in the chain, and then simply feed the transform data from the rigid body back into corresponding. The problem with this method without this feature is that since the objects center of mass is not of the collision shape, the center of mass will simply fall through the ground and 'drag' the rest of the object indefinetly causing it to glitch out. By using this method, this implementation can work as expected, and I've even written a simple tool which can auto calculate the center of mass from several collision objects (not included yet since I want to rewrite it as a native C++ tool). I will likely release a simple example project soon to demonstrate exactly how to set up a ragdoll with this extension in practice.

Since this is a PR aimed at improving 3D ragdoll support, the second major feature of this PR is preventing buggy interactions with rigid bodies chained together in a tree. It simply does this currently by automatically setting all rigid bodies to toplevel during the integration phase. It might be worth considering feeding velocity vectors into chained rigid bodies and implementation might be worth being slightly cleaner, but in general, I consider this much safer and more reliable than the simple implementation of simply integrating with their global positions since the order in which they are integrated does not seem to be determined by their order in the tree, causing potentially unpredictable results. This aspect has also not been extensively profiled as of yet, but I don't imagine it would cause too significant of an impact and I cannot think of an alternative as of yet.

This PR should also allow ragdoll to function even when the ragdoll is programmatically scaled. This aspect of the PR would otherwise be perfectly reliable, but as pointed out in this issue #4491, there is currently a bug with internal implementation of the homegrown physics engine which causes wierd behaviour when scaling cube collision objects. Thankfully, a solution has already been identified which should solve these issues (feeding the scaling data directly into the shape construction), so hopefully @reduz or someone else can implement this fix soon, since this PR really mostly only affects the frontend of the physics system.

data.title: Add instructions about editor font generation
data.body:
The editor fonts that we are using in https://github.com/godotengine/godot/tree/master/tools/editor_fonts were custom-made using fontforge  to merge various glyphs for all supported languages.

We should document (likely in a `tools/editor_fonts/README.md`) how those fonts were designed (source fonts, steps to merge them together in fontforge with the proper glyphs) + their respective licences.

data.title: Use a web-based tool to internationalize Godot engine UI
data.body:
_Bugsquad edit:_ Hijacked the OP as we won't use Transifex but the libre Weblate.

---

[Transifex](https://www.transifex.com/) is a great tool for collaborative translation of applications (as well as websites, etc.).

It is possible to create a free account and with it create one organization to handle different projects on it. If the organization create and translate only open source projects the monthly cost is 0$.

See one example of open source organization that is using transifex [here](https://www.transifex.com/morevnaproject/public/)

And no, this is not spam :-)

data.title: Un-instance a scene
data.body:
Sorry for the strange title but I have no better one in mind right now:

Sometimes I create a new scene and instance it in a first scene, but I later realize it is better not to have it as an external scene, but as part of the first scene. But there is currently no way of asking Godot to take a scene instance and make it so it's not an instance anymore.

In other software you would usually copy the root node, then paste it where you want it to be in the main scene, then delete the duplicate instance. But in Godot you cannot do that. You only have Ctrl+D, which only works within the current scene, not across two.

If there is a way to do that please tell me (Godot is full of hidden features :p), otherwise it should be made easier.

data.title: Make dialogs translatable
data.body: I am not sure dialogs should be translated as it is not located under tools/editor folder. So feel free to drop this PR if it is not necessary.

data.title: Changing the language directly in the project manager
data.body:
Because we can, and since we spawn a new process for the editor anyway, it would be the right time to select another language.

In a more practical context, it would also make it very easy to find if we want to encourage people to make screenshots in English for bug reports, and not in their own locale.

data.title: Connected methods to signal don't get called in correct order.
data.body:
**Operating system - Godot version:**
Ubuntu / Linux - Godot v2.1.alpha.custom_build (built from source) [Last commit (7913e79)](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/7913e792acd656469b29fb90be1dbb7c06a855ba)

**Issue description**:
So what happens is I am connecting two methods to a signal (exit_tree) but this methods don't get called in the order they should be called. **Keep on mind that I am connecting them within a function that gets called by a signal**. On the other hand if I wrap those two methods in one single function, it works as expected. So the problem is connecting those methods individually. 

**Steps to reproduce:**
Video showing the issue in a demo: [QuickDemo-Video.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/288761/QuickDemo-Video.zip)

**Link to minimal example project**:
Here is a demo: [QuickDemo.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/288764/QuickDemo.zip)
